DataElement.preferredName: Conceptual Parent Tissue Biospecimen Investigational Key Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The unique experimental key identifier associated with the parent specimen from which experimental tumor biospecimens will be derived.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Conceptual Parent Tissue Biospecimen Investigational Key Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Something from which one or more similar and separate things have developed, or to which they are attached._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._In the process of being studied; experimental._A value used to identify a record in a database._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Something from which one or more similar and separate things have developed, or to which they are attached.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
